action.action-desc: Mrs. Hayes (for herself, Mr. Jackson of Illinois, Mr. Smith of Washington, Mr. Casten, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Carter of Louisiana, Ms. Norton, and Mr. Figures) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to increase the Federal cost share for supplemental nutrition assistance program administration to improve staffing and retention, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the SNAP Administrator Retention Act of 2025.

section.header: Cost share for SNAP administration for staffing and retention
section.text: Section 16 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2025) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking subsection (k) and inserting subsections (k) and (m); and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Wage standards for State agency personnel
subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the SNAP Administrator Retention Act of 2025, wages of State agency personnel administering the supplemental nutrition assistance program shall be—

paragraph.text: not less than the appropriate rate of pay that would be payable to Federal employees under subchapter III of chapter 53 of title 5, United States Code; and
updated annually by not less than any increase in that rate of pay, including locality adjustments.

subsection.header: Administrative cost-Sharing for staffing and retention

paragraph.text: On approval of a wage plan submitted by a State agency under paragraph (2), the Secretary shall pay to each State agency an amount equal to 100 percent of all administrative personnel costs incurred by the State agency in carrying out the supplemental nutrition assistance program, including all costs associated with—

subparagraph.text: processing, hiring, and training new employees in accordance with the standards described in section 11(e)(6)(B);
complying with the wage standards described in subsection (l).

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the SNAP Administrator Retention Act of 2025, a State agency shall submit to the Secretary for approval the personnel wage plans implemented by the State agency to carry out subsection (l), including the position titles, duties, wages, and appropriate rates of pay of employees.
The Secretary shall make payments to a State agency under paragraph (1) only if the State agency uses the funds received—

subparagraph.text: to supplement, not supplant, non-Federal funds used for existing administrative personnel costs under subsection (a); and
for existing or additional full-time equivalent positions above the number of positions that were held in the State or sub-State area in fiscal year 2024.
